title: Question about Indian bathroom floor
comments:
Grey color on the floor would look unappealing no matter how clean it is maintained. I have it in one of my bathrooms.

Better would be white tiles on the floor with some squares of natural unpolished rough stone in the centre (where you would stand and take a bath and clean your feet)

Both of you are right, you speak from a form and visual appeal point of view, your contractor speaks from a practical maintenance pov. Who cleans the bathroom is your house? That person’s opinion has to have the highest weightage. The biggest issue with lighter bathroom floorings is that it will show grime and soap scum easily and will need a weekly scrubbing, the issue with dark grey is it will make your bathroom look smaller. Why not meet halfway and have that honeycomb mosaic design that comes in a combo of grey, white and a sandy shade? Are you not open to say sandy shades, that way you have another complimentary option.

https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/home/decorating-ideas/g34897917/bathroom-tile-ideas/

https://evolveindia.co/design/50-modern-bathroom-designs/

https://www.magicbricks.com/blog/bathroom-floor-tile-ideas/122714.html
I personally prefer lighter neutral colors. They require regular maintenance but makes the bathroom feel lighter & airer.
